Reason: The _journalDiskSync configuration option is performance-sensitive because it directly affects the system performance at the system level. The code snippet shows that the value of _journalDiskSync determines whether disk synchronization is enabled in the PersistentJournal constructor, which can have a significant impact on performance. Enabling disk synchronization can introduce performance overhead due to the synchronization process, while disabling it may improve performance but at the cost of potential data loss. Therefore, the configuration is considered performance-sensitive as it directly and substantially affects system performance.
